articles.title: S Korea broadband firm sues Netflix after traffic surge from 'Squid Game' - CNA
articles.description:
SEOUL: South Korean Internet service provider SK Broadband has sued Netflix to pay for costs from increased network traffic and maintenance work because of a surge of viewers to the American firm's content, an SK spokesperson said on Friday (Oct 1).

The mo…
articles.content:
Last year, Netflix had brought its own lawsuit on whether it had any obligation to pay SK for network usage, arguing that Netflix's duty ends with creating content and leaving it accessible.
It said… [+1242 chars]

articles.title: British Columbia opens doors for additional COVID-19 vaccine for U.S. travel - Globalnews.ca
articles.description: B.C. provincial health officer Dr. Bonnie Henry says she is still optimistic the Americans will allow travelers into the country with mixed vaccine doses and AstraZeneca.
articles.content:
British Columbians looking to travel to the United States later this fall and into the winter may be able to access an additional COVID-19 dose if required by U.S. regulations.
